Note: Most of these versions are completely independent of each other.
_description: The Ten Commandments — generally eight long lines

Bod841.First Lines:
Haue on god in worschipTake nowch his name in
                    idelschip…
Bod841.Last Lines:
…Theis been comaundementz tenþat god be toke to alle
                    men
Bod841.Editions:
Reichl,  Karl,
                        ed.  
             Religiöse Dichtung im Englischen Hochmittelalter: Untersuchen und
                Edition der Handschrift B. 14.39 des Trinity College in Cambridge.
Münchener Universitäts Schriften, Text und Untersuchungen zur
                Englische Philologie 1
         Munich: Wilhelm Fink, 1973: 334.

CamTCC323.First Lines:
Hawe on god in WrchipeHe ne in þu is nome in
                    idilchipe…
CamTCC323.Last Lines:
…Hoe þat kepit hem ariitHe sulen into heuen
                    bytt
CamTCC323.Note: 16 lines in couplets written 2 per line.

BLHar2391.First Lines: þu schalt haue on god in wyrschypTake not his nayme in yldschype…
BLHar2391.Last Lines: …he þat keps þis commawndmentis xhe schal neuer dye say we amen

BLRoy8Fvii.First Lines:
Haue on gode in worshypeTake not hys name in
                    Idylchyppe…
BLRoy8Fvii.Last Lines:
…Desyre noȝt þi neyȝbores wyfenor þynge
                    þat hym by lythe
BLRoy8Fvii.Note: 5 couplets, with a prose introduction. Written as prose.

NLS18721.First Lines:
[H]aue o god in worchipe[…]k nouth is name in
                    Idelchipe…
NLS18721.Last Lines:
…Loke no þing þat þu steleNe non fals withnesse
                    þat þu bere
NLS18721.Note:
Damaged at beginning of ll. 2-4; tail margin shaved so that ends
                    incomplete, omitting last two commandments.
